website_summaries.verdict: From the budget ZBT line, this ride gives you an intro to Zildjian cymbals without the high price tag.
pros: We love how precise this ride is
The medium high-pitched tone suits most styles of playing
A great beginner cymbal that offers excellent value for money
cons: Not as durable as more expensive models

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful crash
customer_reviews.text: Perfect cymbal if you're looking for a very deep, warm, and round sound. It's exactly what I was looking for and a very good price. It's definetly more of a crash cymbal though, as it's ride function is very bright and sharp. If you're looking for a warm round ride, a crash ride isn't exactly what you're looking for. However, as a deep crash, it is a beautiful cymbal.
customer_reviews.author: M@M

customer_reviews.title: This cymbal is amazing! It's on par with my favorite crash cymbals
customer_reviews.text: This cymbal is amazing! It's on par with my favorite crash cymbals, and i'm comparing it to a Virgil Donati Signature Crash and a K Custom Dark Crash. Never in a million years would I have thought you get get a cymbal like this for the money. This cymbal is a STEAL. You will LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Mosko

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Different cymbals and manufacturing techniques produce different tones. As a drummer of over 30 years and loyal Zildjian player, I have used and do use custom A's and K's. I needed a ride with low wash and a lot of stick definition, and this one does it really well, plus the price doesn't hurt either.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M. Menich

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Cymbals from the ZBT line are honestly just not that great. After trying and returning a lot of different sets from sabian and zildjian, I finally found the perfect balance between quality and price, which is zildjian's ZHT line. It IS discontinued, but you can still find some for a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: T.N.

customer_reviews.title: and this crash ride sounds and feels way too good for the price I paid
customer_reviews.text: I've played drums for 55 years and have 33 Zildjian high end cymbals, and this crash ride sounds and feels way too good for the price I paid. The bunch of ZBT and ZHT cymbals that I also own are so much better than any cheaper lines of cymbals in the 60's, 70's, 80's. Really wish that this quality existed back when I was 9! Go Zildjian!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dach

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: ITS a good cymbal but wasn't paying much attention that it was more of a beginner's cymbal.But in all still can put it to use.I RECCEMOND the seller.Came with great protection in package.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: With this addition to my drum set I'm all set, this cymbal sounds magnificent.
customer_reviews.author: John Pandolfo

customer_reviews.title: A cymbal of my affection!
customer_reviews.text: Great for that jazz fill behind a slow ballad or sax instrumental!
customer_reviews.author: Collector 23

customer_reviews.title: great cymbal at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Great ride for the value. i would recommend to anyone putting together a kit for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Computer Nerd Musician Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good For Its Price
customer_reviews.text: For its price, it's a decent ride that with a lot of high tones. Not a pretty crash, but it can cut through a mix. Not sure if I'd take this to a live setting, however.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Gagnon

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful! I used it to make a large clock! Less than adequate packaging though.
customer_reviews.author: DONALD MARSHALL

customer_reviews.title: Smooth sound, right in the sweet spot
customer_reviews.text: This cymbal was the perfect missing link to my kit. I don't want a huge amount of cymbals and this one is centered right in the range between my hihat and crash and has a lot of dynamic sweet spots as well. Arrived in perfect condition... hope it lasts a long time!
customer_reviews.author: VictorVon

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: It seems the more i use this cymbal the better it sounds. The bell of the cymbal sounds good. I would recommend this size.
customer_reviews.author: R. MORRIS(Tatts)

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, impressive, solid sound, best quality, highly recommend to buy from Zildjian's, for practice or live play. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Sergiy

customer_reviews.title: Very cool ride
customer_reviews.text: Zildjian just makes all the best stuff. Clean, bright ping with just enough sustain that doesnt decay too fast, but doesnt linger too long, either. Im still on the fence about the bell, however. Maybe its just a style thing, but i thought the bell didnt cut too well and sounds a little on the darkish, warm side. Eh, whatever its still a great cymbal,
customer_reviews.author: D. Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: great!
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect replacement for damaged 18-inch crash ride cymbal. Just what my Grandson needed. Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Kullgren

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected!
customer_reviews.text: I knew what to expect when I bought this cymbal. I've been using Zildjians for years so they are perfect for my practice kit.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Very good cymbal
customer_reviews.text: My son the jazz band drummer at his highschool was thrilled to death with this replaement cymbal for his set. Great product and was packaged very well.
customer_reviews.author: William H. Dreibelbis

customer_reviews.title: Crisp clear clean sound
customer_reviews.text: You can use this for gigs. It sounds great, full, not so loud and you can ride it forever!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: As expected - Great product
customer_reviews.text: The ZBT is the lowest class of Zildjian cymbals, but I was quite surprised how this cymbal performed. It's a ride/crash and sounds great for both uses.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Suh

customer_reviews.title: It has a great sound!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas and he loves it! It has a great sound!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Horsley

customer_reviews.title: Packing was so-so but love my new crash
customer_reviews.text: First purchase of this type. Packing was so-so but love my new crash.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: This was donated to the church worship team. They said this required a special stand and have not given me any feedback yet.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Are you new at this?
customer_reviews.text: Drummers can be particular about their cymbals, and many will tell you not to buy this because it has too much tone or ringing some, but if you're not sure exactly what sound you want and you only have a reasonable amount of money at your disposal, this cymbal will definitely treat you well. you can always trust a zildjian to be at least adequate. these are better than that. they have flaws for sure, but when you're jamming on them or in a band, these will definitely get you going for a while, so don't waste your money if you're not completely sure. they really are great cymbals.
customer_reviews.author: mustachiocuz

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than two months
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't really into the sound anyway but it sure broke fast. Lasted just long enough so it couldn't be returned. Sweet.
customer_reviews.author: ldiablo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great price point and still a great ping without muddy aftertones.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is a Zildjian, what else is there to say, NOTHING!
customer_reviews.author: Glenn L. Dupper

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not that expensive and sounds great. We use at our church and have a rock sound.. I recommend
customer_reviews.author: Bronas

customer_reviews.title: Clangy. Cheap product trading on a name
customer_reviews.text: Budget cymbals from all the big makers are generally overpriced brass clunkers, and the ZBT crash/ride is no exception. Good volume, but a nasty, clangy, dominant overtone that is characteristic of cheap, stamped cymbals. At this price, the cast bronze cymbals pouring out of China are a much better choice: some of the same dark, shimmering qualities of the cast bronze Zildjians, without the tight QC standards or hand hammering. Having said that, ZBTs came included with my kit, and have withstood a beating for almost 20 years. I can't imaging, who is cracking this cymbal. It's quite thick and flexible enough. Makes a nice trash cymbal now, with holes drilled and rivets.
customer_reviews.author: Madrok

customer_reviews.title: awesome! all of the zil zbt cymbals i bought ...
customer_reviews.text: awesome ! all of the zil zbt cymbals i bought exceeded expectations...great sound, great feel, especially the 22 inch ride. i would highly recommend these cymbals ! ...almost forgot, great price...i would have paid more, and still been very impressed !
customer_reviews.author: REX FURY

customer_reviews.title: It was pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these from a friend (barely used) and i would say, this thing could take a beating. Pretty good for beginners, and a price like that you just have to get it. One thing beginners should never forget, i learned this the hard way with this cymbal, "Never flip a cymbal upsidedown on a stand and hit it". Yeah, i was a 'nooby' (i guess you could say) at cymbal knowledge, but mines now cracked in two places, but it sounds almost exactly like a brand new Sabian B8 20" ride. Worked pretty well as a crash too, until it cracked of course.
customer_reviews.author: Diane K

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality and sound
customer_reviews.text: I have been playing drums for 28 years now. Started with Zildjian back in the day and then went to Sabian and Paiste. I started jamming for fun again with some locals who have a set at their practice space,I didn't want to leave good cymbals so I picked up used this 18" and a 16" ZBT, as well as a 18" Paiste 303 crash. The ZBT's are the worst sounding cymbals I have EVER played. Trash can and broken glass style sound.. Shame on Zildjian.. Go Sabian B8,Meinhl,or Paiste 303 if you want to go cheap, as least they sound like cymbals.
customer_reviews.author: J. Capobianco

customer_reviews.title: The Sweetest Sound
customer_reviews.text: I began playing clubs when I was 12. Had to sign a waiver to legally play. Throughout my life, I have played in so many bands at so many places and have gone through so many drums and Zildjian cymbals. I just got my 20" ride today. This is, by far, the best cymbal quality I've ever experienced. I also own an Avedis Zildjian from the late 60's (made in Turkey). This USA Zildjian outranks that cymbal and any other cymbal I've ever heard or played...no contest. Sweet. Perfect. I payed $125 in the 60's for the other.....and $79 something for this one. This is a must buy for any drummer.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Chapman Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get this from Amazon so my review isn't shipping related I got it from guitar center. This thing is one of the best ride cymbals I've played. It's super loud. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: aaron stanifer

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used about a year ago, and it was an impressive step up from using my basic kit's crash/ride. I loved it at first, but over time I found that its sound became boring and repetitive; I looked at other rides and the better ones have much more of an unpredictable sound, more natural and clean. I traded my ZBT in today for a Sabian HH, and I'm very happy. My other cymbals: Zildjian K Custom Dark hi-hat, Paiste Twenty 16" crash, Paiste Twenty 8" splash.
customer_reviews.author: MVW

customer_reviews.title: Good Cymbal
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty good crash/ride cymbal. Price is pretty good. My drum teacher uses this one and he knows what good is...
customer_reviews.author: Shalla Art

customer_reviews.title: Great for all rock styles
customer_reviews.text: i play music from hardcore bands like Asking Alexandria and then turn around and play soft rock like Maroon5. it sounds great for crashing and riding (for any rock music and others music i guess) and will put of with lots of abuse without cracking.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Nagel

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ride and I am really pleased, the sound is jazzy but can still be used for rocking. I have no complaints, and the price is unbeatable.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: After 5 months of playing it cracked so bad that its unplayable.
customer_reviews.text: I mean, I guess it sounds good and is a pretty good price, but this thing just broke so much faster than I thought it would last. I would honestly shell out the extra cash for an A custom ,that way it will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: AndrewDrums

product_meta.title: Zildjian ZBT 20" Ride Cymbal
product_meta.description: Size:20"| Style:RideBegin finding your unique voice with Zildjian. Delivering a quality bright and cutting sound, ZBT cymbals are designed to allow the student drummer maximum expression at the right price. ZBT are the perfect set for studying and performing any style of music on the drum set, in the school concert band or marching band. Made from a B8 alloy (92% Copper, 8% Tin) with pioneering hammering technology in the legendary Zildjian Sound Lab, these cymbals project with excellent response, for a sonic experience unlike other entry-level cymbals. For a trusted cymbal sound along every step of your journey from beginner to pro, choose to play ZBT by Zildjian. All Zildjian cymbals have a two-year Zildjian warranty when purchased new from an authorized retailer.
feature_bullets: The perfect cymbal choice for beginners and student drummers
Learn and explore all styles – pop, rock, jazz and more – with ZBT
Bright, high-pitched sound that cuts through easily in all playing situations
Make serious music at a great value for your money
Made in the USA by the trusted name in cymbals since 1623

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars114 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
